metadata.title: CVE-2018-10914 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
It was found that an attacker could issue a xattr request via glusterfsFUSE to cause gluster brick process to crash which will result in a remotedenial of service. If gluster multiplexing is enabled this will result in acrash of multiple bricks and gluster volumes.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10914` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.4-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.4-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.4-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.4-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.4-1').
